section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The redacted values for the term length and end date create ambiguity. Without knowing the exact duration, it's impossible to determine the actual termination date, leading to potential disputes over the agreement's validity period and obligations.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: Section 22 states that if the consultant is unable to play tour golf ADAMS GOLF may terminate the agreement and be repaid. However, section 8C states 'In the event of ADAMS GOLF'S insolvency or bankruptcy, it is expressly agreed to by the parties that CONSULTANT shall not be obligated to repay any money so long as CONSULTANT continues to fully perform his obligations under this Agreement.' This indicates that only insolvency or bankruptcy is an exclusion to repayment of fees. The contradiction is that this section will result in the repayment of fees in the event of consultant death or inablity to play tour golf, which is contradictory to Section 8C.

section: CONSULTANT agrees to protect, indemnify and hold ADAMS GOLF harmless from any and all liability, claims, causes of action, suits, damages and expenses (excluding attorneys' fees and expenses) for which it becomes liable or is compelled to pay by reason of a breach of any covenant or representation by CONSULTANT in this Agreement. However, ADAMS GOLF will cover CONSULTANT's attorney fees up to $10,000.
explanation: The clause initially excludes attorney's fees from the consultant's indemnification obligation but then states Adams Golf will cover consultant's attorney fees up to $10,000. This creates ambiguity and potential contradiction. It's unclear if the consultant is responsible for all attorney's fees above $10,000, or if the exclusion applies to all attorney's fees regardless of the amount.
